q1.text: What does a red octagonal sign mean?
q1.explain: A red octagonal sign is a STOP sign. You must come to a complete stop.

q2.text: What is the speed limit in residential areas in Saudi Arabia?
q2.explain: The speed limit in residential areas is typically 40 km/h unless otherwise posted.

q3.text: When should you use your vehicle's headlights?
q3.b: During rain, fog, or low visibility
q3.explain: Use headlights during rain, fog, sandstorms, or any condition with reduced visibility.

q4.text: What does a flashing yellow traffic light mean?
q4.explain: A flashing yellow light means proceed with caution. Slow down and be prepared to stop.

q5.text: What do double solid yellow lines in the center of the road indicate?
q5.explain: Double solid yellow lines mean no passing is allowed from either direction.

q6.text: What is the maximum speed limit on highways in Saudi Arabia?
q6.explain: The maximum speed limit on highways in Saudi Arabia is typically 120 km/h for cars.

q7.text: Who is required to wear a seatbelt in Saudi Arabia?
q7.explain: All occupants of a vehicle are required to wear seatbelts in Saudi Arabia.

q8.text: What does a triangular sign with the point facing down mean?
q8.explain: An inverted triangle (point down) is a yield/give way sign. You must give priority to other traffic.

q9.text: At a roundabout, who has the right of way?
q9.d: Vehicles coming from the right only
q9.explain: Vehicles already circulating in the roundabout have the right of way.

q10.text: What is the safe following distance rule?
q10.explain: Maintain a 2-3 second gap from the vehicle ahead. Increase this in bad weather.

q11.text: What must you do when a traffic light turns red?
q11.b: Slow down but proceed if clear
q11.explain: You must come to a complete stop before the stop line when the traffic light is red.

q12.text: What does a red circle with a white horizontal bar mean?
q12.explain: A red circle with a white horizontal bar is the 'No Entry' sign. Vehicles cannot enter.

q13.a: On straight roads with good visibility
q13.b: Near curves, hills, intersections, and pedestrian crossings
q13.explain: Overtaking is prohibited near curves, hills, intersections, pedestrian crossings, and where marked.

q14.text: What should you do when an emergency vehicle approaches with sirens?
q14.a: Speed up to get out of the way
q14.c: Pull over to the right and stop
q14.explain: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop to allow emergency vehicles to pass.

q15.text: What do white zebra stripes on the road indicate?
q15.explain: White zebra stripes indicate a pedestrian crossing. Drivers must yield to pedestrians.

q16.text: How far from a fire hydrant must you park?
q16.explain: You must park at least 5 meters away from a fire hydrant to allow emergency access.

q17.text: What does it mean when a traffic police officer extends their arm horizontally?
q17.a: Stop for vehicles approaching from that direction
q17.explain: An extended arm means stop for vehicles approaching from that direction.

q18.text: What should you do if your tire blows out while driving?
q18.b: Grip the steering firmly, ease off the gas, and slow down gradually
q18.c: Turn sharply to the side of the road
q18.explain: Hold the steering wheel firmly, gradually ease off the accelerator, and slow down safely.

q19.text: A circular sign with a red border and black number '60' means:
q19.explain: A red-bordered circular sign with a number indicates the maximum speed limit.

q20.text: Is using a mobile phone while driving allowed in Saudi Arabia?
q20.explain: Using a handheld mobile phone while driving is strictly prohibited in Saudi Arabia.

q21.text: How do wet roads affect braking distance?
q21.c: Braking distance can double or more
q21.explain: Wet roads reduce tire traction, which can double or triple your braking distance.

q22.text: What does a blue circular sign with white arrows in a circle mean?
q22.explain: A blue circular sign with white circular arrows indicates a roundabout ahead.

q23.text: What do white arrows painted on the road indicate?
q23.b: Direction you must travel in that lane
q23.explain: Road arrows indicate the permitted direction(s) of travel for that lane.

q24.text: What is the minimum age to obtain a driving license in Saudi Arabia?
q24.explain: You must be at least 18 years old to obtain a private driving license in Saudi Arabia.

q25.text: What does a green arrow signal at a traffic light mean?
q25.c: You may proceed in the direction of the arrow
q25.explain: A green arrow allows you to proceed safely in the direction the arrow points.

q26.text: Where should children under 10 years old sit in a vehicle?
q26.explain: Children under 10 must sit in the back seat with appropriate child restraints.

q27.text: A yellow diamond sign with a curved arrow indicates:
q27.explain: Yellow diamond signs are warning signs. A curved arrow warns of a curve ahead.

q28.text: When parking uphill with a curb, which way should your front wheels point?
q28.explain: When parking uphill with a curb, turn wheels away from curb so the car rolls into the curb if brakes fail.

q29.text: What is the best action if you feel drowsy while driving?
q29.explain: If drowsy, the only safe action is to pull over and rest. Temporary fixes don't work.

q30.text: When should you use hazard warning lights?
q30.b: When your vehicle has broken down or is stationary and causing an obstruction
q30.explain: Use hazard lights when your vehicle is broken down, in an emergency, or obstructing traffic.

q31.text: What does a circular sign with a red border, blue background, and red diagonal line mean?
q31.explain: A blue circle with red border and single diagonal line means no parking.

q32.text: On a multi-lane road, which lane is for overtaking?
q32.explain: In Saudi Arabia, the left lane is for overtaking. Return to the right after passing.

q33.a: An area where your vision is blocked by the sun
q33.b: An area not visible in your mirrors that requires a head check
q33.explain: A blind spot is an area around your vehicle not visible in mirrors. Always check by turning your head.

q34.text: What does 'BUS' written in a lane indicate?
q34.explain: BUS marked on a lane means it is reserved for buses only during operating hours.

q35.text: What is the typical speed limit in school zones when children are present?
q35.explain: School zones typically have a 30 km/h speed limit when children are present.

q36.text: When is it appropriate to use your horn?
q36.b: To warn others of danger or your presence
q36.d: Late at night in residential areas
q36.explain: Use your horn only to warn other road users of danger or to make your presence known.

q37.text: What should you do at a railway crossing when the barrier is down?
q37.a: Go around the barrier if no train is visible
q37.b: Wait until the barrier is fully raised
q37.c: Proceed slowly if the train has passed
q37.explain: Always wait until the barrier is fully raised before proceeding at a railway crossing.

q38.text: What does a blue square sign with a white walking figure indicate?
q38.explain: Blue signs with pedestrian symbols indicate pedestrian crossings or zones.

q39.text: What is the legal blood alcohol limit for driving in Saudi Arabia?
q39.explain: Alcohol is completely prohibited in Saudi Arabia. There is zero tolerance for driving under the influence.

q40.text: What is the primary purpose of an airbag?
q40.b: To cushion occupants during a collision
q40.d: To make the car look modern
q40.explain: Airbags cushion occupants and reduce impact forces during a collision. They work with seatbelts, not as replacements.

q41.text: What does a broken white line in the center of the road mean?
q41.explain: A broken white line indicates you may cross it to overtake when it is safe to do so.

q42.text: When should you use fog lights?
q42.b: Only in heavy fog or severely reduced visibility
q42.explain: Use fog lights only in conditions of heavy fog, mist, or when visibility is seriously reduced.

q43.text: What does a blue rectangular sign with a white arrow pointing up mean?
q43.explain: A blue rectangular sign with a white arrow pointing ahead indicates a one-way street.

q44.b: When tires lose contact with the road due to water
q44.explain: Aquaplaning occurs when tires ride on top of water, losing contact with the road surface.

q45.text: Who has priority at a zebra crossing?
q45.explain: Pedestrians have priority at zebra crossings. Drivers must stop to let them cross.

q46.text: How far before turning should you signal?
q46.explain: Signal at least 30 meters before turning to give other road users adequate warning.

q47.text: When driving at night, what should you do when another vehicle approaches with high beams on?
q47.b: Look at the right edge of the road
q47.explain: Look toward the right edge of the road to avoid being blinded by oncoming high beams.

q48.text: What does a sign with black diagonal stripes on white background mean?
q48.explain: Black diagonal stripes on white indicate the end of all previously applicable restrictions.

q49.text: What must you do when entering a tunnel?
q49.a: Turn on headlights and remove sunglasses
q49.explain: Always turn on headlights when entering a tunnel and remove sunglasses to adjust to the lower light.

q50.text: How often should you check your tire pressure?
q50.b: At least once a month and before long trips
q50.explain: Check tire pressure at least monthly and before any long journey for safety and fuel efficiency.

vp-001.text: According to traffic regulations, how many points can lead to license suspension within a Hijri year?
vp-001.explain: In general practice, accumulating 24 points can lead to suspension.

vp-002.text: What happens the first time a driver reaches 24 points within a Hijri year?
vp-002.explain: First time reaching 24 points results in a 3-month suspension.

vp-003.text: What is the penalty the second time a driver reaches 24 points within a Hijri year?
vp-003.explain: Second time reaching 24 points results in a 6-month suspension.

vp-004.text: What is the penalty the third time a driver reaches 24 points within a Hijri year?
vp-004.explain: Third time reaching 24 points results in a 1-year suspension.

vp-005.text: What happens the fourth time a driver reaches 24 points within a Hijri year?
vp-005.explain: Fourth time reaching 24 points leads to permanent revocation.

vp-006.text: In general practice, the 24-point limit is calculated within which period?
vp-006.explain: The 24-point limit is calculated within a Hijri year.

vp-007.text: How many points are assigned for driving a vehicle under the influence (Alcohol/Drugs)?
vp-007.explain: Driving under the influence carries 24 points.

vp-008.text: How many points are assigned for drifting?

vp-009.text: How many points are assigned for running a red traffic light?
vp-009.explain: Running a red light carries 12 points.

vp-010.text: How many points are assigned for driving in the opposite direction of traffic?
vp-010.explain: Driving in the opposite direction carries 12 points.

vp-011.text: How many points are assigned for weaving through traffic on public roads?

vp-012.text: How many points are assigned for not complying with a traffic officer’s manual signal?
vp-012.explain: Not complying with the officer’s signal carries 8 points.

vp-013.text: How many points are assigned for driving a vehicle without brakes or lights?
vp-013.explain: Driving without brakes or lights carries 8 points.

vp-014.text: How many points are assigned for not stopping completely at a stop sign?
vp-014.explain: Not stopping at a stop sign carries 6 points.

vp-015.text: Failing to observe right-of-way rules results in how many points?
vp-015.explain: Failing to observe right-of-way carries 6 points.

vp-016.text: Exceeding the speed limit by more than 25 km/h results in how many points?
vp-016.explain: Speeding more than 25 km/h carries 6 points.

vp-017.text: Not yielding to cars inside a roundabout results in how many points?
vp-017.explain: Not yielding in roundabouts carries 6 points.

vp-018.text: Overtaking in prohibited areas results in how many points?
vp-018.explain: Overtaking in prohibited areas carries 6 points.

vp-019.text: Stopping on railway tracks results in how many points?
vp-019.explain: Stopping on railway tracks carries 6 points.

vp-020.text: Exceeding the speed limit by up to 25 km/h results in how many points?
vp-020.explain: Speeding up to 25 km/h carries 4 points.

vp-021.text: Driving on lanes not designated for the vehicle results in how many points?
vp-021.explain: Driving on non-designated lanes carries 4 points.

vp-022.text: Overtaking school buses while students are boarding or disembarking results in how many points?

vp-023.text: Not covering the load and cargo during transport results in how many points?

vp-024.text: Modifying vehicle structure or body without proper authorization results in how many points?

vp-025.text: Not wearing a seatbelt results in how many points?
vp-025.explain: Not wearing a seatbelt carries 2 points.

vp-026.text: Using a hand-held mobile phone while driving results in how many points?
vp-026.explain: Using a hand-held mobile phone carries 2 points.

vp-027.text: Not wearing a helmet while riding motorized bikes results in how many points?
vp-027.explain: Not wearing a helmet carries 2 points.

tf-001.text: In general practice, what is the main purpose of traffic fines?
tf-001.a: To improve road safety and reduce accidents
tf-001.explain: Fines are intended to encourage safer driving habits.

tf-002.text: Which type of violation usually carries the highest fine?
tf-002.a: Very serious violations that endanger lives
tf-002.explain: Very serious violations typically carry the highest fines.

tf-003.text: Why can fines increase for repeated violations?
tf-003.explain: Repeat violations usually lead to higher penalties to encourage compliance.

tf-004.text: Are traffic fines intended to improve road safety?
tf-004.b: No, they are only for revenue
tf-004.explain: Fines are designed to promote safer driving.

tf-005.text: Minor traffic violations usually result in:
tf-005.explain: Minor violations generally carry lower fines.

tf-006.text: In practice, not wearing a seatbelt usually results in:
tf-006.explain: Seatbelt violations are typically treated as moderate.

tf-007.text: Using a hand-held mobile phone while driving usually results in:
tf-007.explain: Phone use while driving is treated as more serious.

tf-008.text: Serious violations like running a red light are usually punished with:
tf-008.explain: Dangerous behavior usually carries higher fines.

tf-009.text: Light speeding is generally categorized as:
tf-009.explain: Light speeding is typically treated as moderate.

tf-010.explain: Parking issues are usually categorized as minor.

tf-011.a: A serious violation with higher fines
tf-011.explain: Excessive speeding is treated as serious.

tf-012.text: Very serious violations usually lead to:
tf-012.explain: Very serious violations can carry heavier fines and penalties.

violationPoints.title: Traffic Violation Point System (Educational)
violationPoints.intro: The point system is designed to penalize drivers who commit traffic violations, with each infraction being assigned a specific number of points. As points accumulate, penalties become more severe. The purpose of this system is to encourage safer driving habits and reduce accidents.
violationPoints.impactTitle: Understanding the Impact of Accumulating 24 Points (Hijri Year):

penalties.first: First time reaching 24 points: License suspension for 3 months.
penalties.second: Second time reaching 24 points: License suspension for 6 months.
penalties.third: Third time reaching 24 points: License suspension for 1 year.
penalties.fourth: Fourth time reaching 24 points: Permanent revocation of the driving license.

violationPoints.closing: This system encourages drivers to follow traffic regulations and drive responsibly. Driving is a responsibility, and safe behavior helps protect all road users.

trafficFines.title: Traffic Fines in Saudi Arabia (Educational Guide)
trafficFines.intro: Saudi Arabia applies traffic fines to encourage safer driving and reduce accidents. Violations are grouped by how serious they are, and each group generally carries a financial penalty. More serious or repeated violations can lead to higher fines and additional penalties.

categories.minor: Minor violations: Lower fines, usually for parking issues or minor non-compliance.
categories.moderate: Moderate violations: Medium fines for behaviors such as not wearing a seatbelt or light speeding.
categories.serious: Serious violations: Higher fines for dangerous behavior such as using a mobile phone while driving, running red lights, or excessive speeding.
categories.verySerious: Very serious violations: Heavy fines and additional penalties for actions that endanger lives.

trafficFines.closing: Drivers are encouraged to follow traffic rules to avoid fines and contribute to safer roads.
